title: spack reindex uses full hash length although install_hash_length: 8 in config.yaml

labels.name: triage
labels.description: The issue needs to be prioritized

body:
Dear all

I updated spack today (pull onto my install from March this year). When I try to reindex the package db, I get errors like this:

```
[swadm@build01 defaults]$ spack reindex
==> Error: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: '/cfs/software/spack/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-4.8.5/gcc-4.9.4-fz7hgwhylw6ubl4ezih77f27y3ewi7g6'
```

It seems that Spack tries to use full length hashes in the name of the package install dir. Actually, in my config.yaml I've set install_hash_length: 8 and hence the real install dir of the package in the error above is:

```
cfs/software/spack/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-4.8.5/gcc-4.9.4-fz7hgwhy
```

### Steps to reproduce the issue

Using 

```
spack find -l
```

I can see all installed packages indicating a correct hash.

When I use

```
spack reindex
```

I get the error above.
